question: Who has been named the new Ambassador for World Wide Fund (WWF) India’s Environment Education programme?
explanation:
Legendary Indian Chess player and five-time World chess champion Viswanathan Anand has been named the new Ambassador for World Wide Fund (WWF) India’s Environment Education programme.
WWF India is celebrating 50 years of its presence and conservation in India. It aims to impart environment education and awareness to school children, youth and citizens across the country. The programme covers over 50 lakh school-children across the country.
